hedline.hl1: The Big City; To Our Guests

abstract.p: John Tierney The Big City column humorously discusses disclosure of guest list at White House during Clinton Administration and link to raising campaign funds for Hillary Rodham Clinton's Senate race in New York; photo (M)

block.p: WELCOME to the Lincoln Bedroom! This room has a special place in the history of the nation; and, more important, in the history of the Clinton family. It's where our best friends stay. We can't always be here to welcome you personally, but whether you're spending the night or taking a Junior Donor Nap, you'll always find clean towels and warm hospitality. So relax! You're family.

For your safety and comfort, please keep your name tag clearly visible when walking in the hall. At night we don't always recognize our friends, especially the new ones from New York, and the Secret Service agents react forcefully if one of us screams for help.

Telephone
Press 0 for Room Service.
9 for Democratic National Committee.
8 for New York Senate 2000 committee.
1 through 7 for the Friends of Hillary.
For security reasons, other outside calls are not permitted. In an emergency, room service can arrange a wire transfer of funds.
Room Service
Continental Breakfast: $4,999.00. (Includes coffee or tea, toast, fruit juice. For cream or butter, add $250.00.)
A full breakfast menu is available on request, complete with financing options.
For security reasons, guests may not bring their own food or beverages.
Television
We are pleased to offer the following feature presentations free of charge on channels 1 through 5:
''Profiles in Generosity.'' True stories of daring campaign donors who changed the course of history.

''But Do They Like Me for Myself?'' The self-doubts of the affluent are examined by Anthony Robbins. Let the motivational guru who counseled Bill teach you the secret of self-acceptance: ''As long as you've got money, why not be liked for it?''
''It Takes a Village.'' Dramatic adaptation, narrated by Meg Ryan, followed by panel discussion.

''Home Movies.'' Don't groan! Relive our family's most hilarious moments. See Bill do a double-take at Steven Spielberg's house when he sees the number on Barbra Streisand's pledge card. Join Hillary's laughter when Chevy Chase gives a ''noogie'' to Ted Danson until he signs the check.
''I Make a Mean Tossed Salad.'' The 18-minute video that started the magic: Linda Bloodworth-Thomason's biography that kicked off Hillary's campaign.
Regular television programming is also available. ($3,500.00.)
Turndown Service.

At no charge, mints and pledge cards will be left on your pillow by a member of the Democratic National Committee, who will explain the full benefits available through the Frequent-Sleeper Awards Program (starting with a complimentary bucket of ice!)
A Room With a Rich Tradition.

This very room, Abraham Lincoln said, put him ''in a New York state of mind.'' He often came here late at night to ask guests for donations for the 1864 Senate race in New York. He was determined to stop a ruthless, baby-faced politician from Long Island who was running with a plan to ban soft money contributions; including ones in this very bedroom!
Memories to Last a Lifetime.

The plush Presidential Bathrobe in the closet is yours to keep. ($15,000 has been charged to your account.) You are welcome to take your toothbrush, shampoo or any other toiletry item with a Presidential Seal. ($150 per item; $500 if personally autographed by President.) Also available are the Lincoln Bedroom's hand-carved bed, lamps and other furnishings. (For pricing, contact Democratic National Committee.)
All major credit cards accepted.
